getServerNeededUpdatePackageByName

public static java.lang.Long getServerNeededUpdatePackageByName(java.lang.Long sid,
                                                                java.lang.String packageName)
Get the ID of the package that needs updating based on the name. So, if say the server has up2date version 2.8.0 and the latest rev of up2date is 3.1.1 this will return the ID of the package for 3.1.1

Parameters:
sid - of system
packageName - of system - up2date for example
Returns:
Long id of package if found. null if not.

lookupEvrIdByPackageName

public static java.util.Map lookupEvrIdByPackageName(java.lang.Long sid,
                                                     java.lang.String name)
Find the most up to date package with the given name accessible to a system with the given system id.

Parameters:
sid - The id of a system to which the package must be accessible.
name - The exact name of the package sought for.
Returns:
A map with keys 'name_id' and 'evr_id' containing Long types. Null if nothing found.

verCmp

public static int verCmp(java.lang.String epoch1,
                         java.lang.String version1,
                         java.lang.String release1,
                         java.lang.String epoch2,
                         java.lang.String version2,
                         java.lang.String release2)
Compares an evr to another evr.

Parameters:
epoch1 - Epoch 1
version1 - Version 1
release1 - Release 1
epoch2 - Epoch 2
version2 - Version 2
release2 - Release 2
Returns:
Returns 1 if EVR1 > EVR2, -1 if EVR1 < EVR2, and 0 if EVR1 == EVR2.

schedulePackageRemoval

public static void schedulePackageRemoval(User user,
                                          Package pkg)
                                   throws PermissionCheckFailureException
Deletes a package from the system

Parameters:
user - calling user
pkg - package to delete
Throws:
PermissionCheckFailureException - - caller is not an org admin, the package is in one of the RH owned channels, or is in different org

lookupPackageNameOverview

public static DataResult lookupPackageNameOverview(Org org,
                                                   java.lang.String packageName,
                                                   java.lang.String[] channelarches)
Returns package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels whose arch is one of the 'channelArches'.

Parameters:
org - The users Org.
packageName - Name of package being sought.
channelarches - list of valid channel arches. i.e.
  • channel-ia32
  • channel-ia64
  • channel-sparc
  • channel-alpha
  • channel-s390
  • channel-s390x
  • channel-iSeries
  • channel-pSeries
  • channel-x86_64
  • channel-ppc
  • channel-sparc-sun-solaris
  • channel-i386-sun-solaris
Returns:
package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels whose arch is one of the 'channelArches'.

lookupPackageForChannelFromChannel

public static DataResult lookupPackageForChannelFromChannel(java.lang.Long fromCid,
                                                            java.lang.Long toCid)
Lookup packages contained in fromCid that are eligable to be put in toCid. Packages are filtered based on channel/package arch, and excluded if a package with the same nvrea exists in the toCid

Parameters:
fromCid - channel id to pull packages from
toCid - channel id of channel that you will be pushing packges to (later on)
Returns:
DataResult of PackageOverview objects

lookupCustomPackagesForChannel

public static DataResult lookupCustomPackagesForChannel(java.lang.Long cid,
                                                        java.lang.Long orgId)
Lookup custom packages (packages with org_id of the current user) that can be pushed into the a channel (cid). Packages are filtered based on channel/package arch, and excluded if a package with the same nvrea exists in the toCid

Parameters:
cid - channel id of channel that you will be pushing packges to (later on)
orgId - the org of the custom packages
Returns:
DataResult of PackageOverview objects

lookupOrphanPackagesForChannel

public static DataResult lookupOrphanPackagesForChannel(java.lang.Long cid,
                                                        java.lang.Long orgId)
Lookup orphaned custom packages (those that belong to no channel) for insertion into a channel. Packages are filtered based on channel/package arch, and if a package already exists in the channel based of it's nvrea.

Parameters:
cid - the channel to look at for inserting
orgId - the org who owns the packages
Returns:
list of PackageOverview objects

public static java.util.List<PackageDto> listPackageDtosForErrata(Errata errata)
List package's for an errata. This was mainly made for the errata xmlrpc handler was created to be fast.

errata - the errata
Returns:
list of Packages

the changelog as a string or null if package isn't readable/doesn't exist

verifyPackagesChannelArchCompatAndOrgAccess

public static void verifyPackagesChannelArchCompatAndOrgAccess(User user,
                                                               Channel channel,
                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Long> packageIds,
                                                               boolean checkArchCompat)
Throw exception, if any of the packages aren't accessible by user or aren't compatible with provided channel arch

Parameters:
user - user
channel - channel
packageIds - package ids
checkArchCompat - optionally arch compatibility doesn't have to be checked (f.e. when removing packages, only orgt access is important)
